page.title: 07YANWORTH - LACK OF AMENITIES
page.content: Many rural areas blame "retired city types", "weekenders" and affluent two car commuters for losing services. This hardly applies in this particular area and {Yanworth never had or can {barely remember some basic amenities. The{village school}finally closed in 1945 after evacuee children gave it a temporary reprieve in 1940. Now primary children have to travel to Chedworth or Northleach, both 4.5 kms. and secondary children to Northleach or Bourton-on-the-Water about 14 kms. The {nearest railway station }was Foss Cross, about 6.5 kms., and that offered a slow infrequent service. A{daily bus service}never existed, a {weekly service}to Cheltenham closed in the mid 1960's and {now only a {single Friday afternoon service allows {mainly older people from surrounding {villages to shop in Cirencester.
